the present perfect requires two verbs a
helping verb and a main verb our helping
verb will be either have or has the main
verb will be a past participle
that's the third form of a verb for
example eaten for eat driven for drive
bin for B and so on
now I said that our helping verbs are

contract with pronouns the contractions

I've you've we've they've she's he's

so the first reason why we use the
present perfect is to connect the past
to the present something began in the
past and it continues till now again why
do we use the present perfect our first
and most basic reason is to make a
connection between the past and the
present to state that something such as
a condition or situation began in the
past and continues to the present now I
want you to remember that as I begin to
list all these reasons for using the
present perfect that sometimes more than
one reason can explain why we're using
this tense in a sentence
okay let's be certain you understand the
first reason for using the present
perfect which is to make a connection
between the past and the present our
first example life has been crazy for
the past two months my current situation
then is crazy
and by using the present perfect I'm
telling you that it was crazy in the
past and it continues to be crazy now
second example I've thought about making
a DVD of lessons here by using the
present perfect I'm telling you that I
had this thought in my mind in the past
and I continue to have it in my mind now
in the present
